problem.tex: Let $f$ be an analytic function on a region containing $\{z\in\mathbb{C}:|z|\leq4\}$. Suppose that $|f(z)|\leq1$ whenever $|z|\leq4$. Prove that $|f(z_1)-f(z_2)|\leq\frac{8}{9}$ whenever $|z_1|,|z_2|\leq1$.

solution.tex: By Cauchy's integral formula, \[|f(z_1)-f(z_2)|=\left|\frac{1}{2\pi i}\int_{|z|=4}\frac{f(w)}{(w-z_1)}-\frac{f(w)}{(w-z_2)}dw\right|=\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{|z|=4}\left|\frac{f(w)(z_2-z_1)}{(w-z_1)(w-z_2)}\right||dw|.\] We know $|f(w)|\leq1$, $|z_2-z_1|\leq|z_2|+|z_1|<2$, and for $j=1,2$ that $|w-z_j|\geq|w|-|z_j|>4-1=3$. Thus \[\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{|z|=4}\left|\frac{f(w)(z_2-z_1)}{(w-z_1)(w-z_2)}\right||dw|\leq\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{|z|=4}\frac{1\cdot2}{3\cdot3}|dw|=\frac{1}{2\pi}\cdot\frac{2}{9}\cdot8\pi=\frac{8}{9}.\]
